etymology.description: semantic 辶(辶) (chuò, "walk") + phonetic 冓(冓) (gòu, "meet") = walking to meet -> to meet
etymology.interpretation: The character 遘(遘) (gòu, "to meet") combines 辶(辶) (chuò, "walk"), indicating movement, with 冓(冓) (gòu, "to meet") for its phonetic component to convey the act of walking to meet someone.

examples.chinese: 他在市集遘旧友(他在市集遘舊友)。
examples.english: He encountered an old friend at the market.

examples.chinese: 他远行时遘良师(他遠行時遘良師)，心中满是感激(心中滿是感激)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yuǎnxíng shí gòu liángshī, xīnzhōng mǎn shì gǎnjī.
examples.english: During his journey, he encountered a wise teacher, and his heart was filled with gratitude.
